TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TrackBarRenderer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods used to render a track bar control with visual styles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TrackBarRenderer class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render each part of a track bar control with the current visual style of the operating system. Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control. This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should have the appearance of the current visual style.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows, the methods in this class will draw the track bar with the current visual style. Otherwise, the methods in this class will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. To determine whether the members of this class can be used, you can check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.
This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TrackBar?displayProperty=fullName> class. For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a custom control that uses the TrackBarRenderer methods to draw a horizontal track bar that responds to mouse clicks.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.t_78_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.t_78_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.t_78_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DrawBottomPointingThumb (System.Drawing.Graphics g, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TrackBarThumbState state);

.method public static hidebysig void DrawBottomPointingThumb(class System.Drawing.Graphics g, valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TrackBarThumbState state) cil managed

Docs.param: The used to draw the track bar slider.
The that specifies the bounds of the track bar slider.
One of the values that specifies the visual state of the track bar slider.
Docs.summary: Draws a downward-pointing track bar slider (also known as the thumb) with visual styles.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Before calling this method, you should verify that the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property is `true`.

Docs.exception:
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DrawHorizontalTicks (System.Drawing.Graphics g, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, int numTicks, System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EdgeStyle edgeStyle);

.method public static hidebysig void DrawHorizontalTicks(class System.Drawing.Graphics g, valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, int32 numTicks, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EdgeStyle edgeStyle) cil managed

Docs.param: The used to draw the ticks.
The that specifies the bounds of the ticks.
The number of ticks to draw.
One of the values.
Docs.summary: Draws the specified number of horizontal track bar ticks with visual styles.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before calling this method, you should verify that the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property is `true`.
If width or height of the bounding rectangle or the number of ticks is less than or equal to zero, or `g` is `null`, DrawHorizontalTicks returns without rendering.

Docs.exception:

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsSupported { get; }
.property bool IsSupported

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the class can be used to draw a track bar with visual styles.
Docs.value: if the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is `false`, the methods of this class will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
## Examples The following code example uses the IsSupported property to determine whether to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer> methods. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer> class.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_136_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer#4](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_136_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarRenderer#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_136_1.vb)]
